Key Arguments: The legislation could lead to the government becoming the 'sole arbiter of truth'.
The bill is against the ethics of fairness and equality, as it may stifle debate and silence dissenting voices.
Freedom of expression and speech are fundamental rights that should be protected.
The bill could cause Australia to regress into a state of limited free exchange of ideas.
Notable Quotes: It horrifies me to think that our government will be the 'sole arbiter of truth'.
Please do not let our country REGRESS into an Orwellian propagandised shell of what once was a vibrant and exciting country full of animated debate and free exchange of ideas.
